title: Common Lujvo Patterns
goal: Learn common lujvo patterns with se/te conversions.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Lujvo review:

selsku = ? (meaning)
glibau = ? (meaning)

(Answers: what is said, English language)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
seljmi x1 is what is understood by x2 about x3 what is understood
terdi x1 is Earth/ground of territory x2 Earth

The sel-/ter-/vel- Pattern

Many useful lujvo are created by fusing conversion operators with gismu:

Pattern Conversion Example
sel- + rafsi se + gismu selsku (what is said)
ter- + rafsi te + gismu terdi (Earth*)
vel- + rafsi ve + gismu velkla (route)

*Note: terdi actually comes from a different etymology, but illustrates the pattern.

Examples in Detail

jimpe — x1 understands x2 about x3

seljmi (se jimpe fused) — x1 is what is understood

mi jimpe la seljmi

I understand what is understood. (I understand the concept.)

Creating Your Own Mental Model

When you see sel-:

  1. Think of the base gismu
  2. Apply se (swap x1↔x2)
  3. The new x1 is the old x2

More Examples

Lujvo Base Meaning
selsku cusku what is said
seljmi jimpe what is understood
seltavla tavla what is talked about
seldunda dunda what is given (the gift)

terdi — Earth

terdi means Earth (the planet) or ground/land.

la terdi cu barda

Earth is big.

mi zvati la terdi

I am on Earth.

Key Point

The sel-/ter-/vel- prefixes create lujvo from conversions, making the old x2/x3/x4 the new x1.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Interpret sel- Lujvo

What does each mean?

  1. selsku (from cusku: x1 says x2)
  2. seljmi (from jimpe: x1 understands x2)
  3. seldunda (from dunda: x1 gives x2)
Answers
  1. What is said (the content, original x2)
  2. What is understood (the concept, original x2)
  3. What is given (the gift, original x2)

Exercise 2: Use seljmi

Translate:

  1. I understand this.
  2. This is what I understand.
  3. What is understood is important.
Answers
  1. mi jimpe ti
  2. ti seljmi mi
  3. lo seljmi cu vajni

Exercise 3: Use terdi

Translate:

  1. Earth is beautiful.
  2. I live on Earth.
  3. Earth is our home.
Answers
  1. la terdi cu melbi
  2. mi xabju la terdi
  3. la terdi cu zdani mi'o (mi'o = we including you)

items.answer: What is said (the content, original x2)
What is understood (the concept, original x2)
What is given (the gift, original x2)
`la terdi cu zdani mi'o` (mi'o = we including you)

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I understand what is said." → mi jimpe lo selsku
  2. "Earth is big." → la terdi cu barda
  3. "This is what I understand." → ti seljmi mi

Prefix Makes new x1 =

Summary

You learned the sel-/ter-/vel- lujvo pattern. These fuse conversion operators with gismu to create useful compound words.
